blog.name: reluctantly-awesome
blog.title: Itty Bitty Black Hole
blog.description: Blah blah blah you couldn't care less about this, am I right?

tags: id tag the blog but im not ready to out them just yet
summary: anti Dany blog: no character in got/asoiaf should be completely good; fantasy can have grey characters, I'm so bored of pure...
body:
anti Dany blog: no character in got/asoiaf should be completely good; fantasy can have grey characters, I’m so bored of pure characters or completely evil characters!!!

the same blog: here’s 50 bullet points on how I’ve bought into the sexist rhetoric of the show and believe Dany to be completely evil and not a complex character like the male characters and why I want her dead

blog.name: liz-carter-art
blog.title: Crumpled Paper
blog.description: I'm a BU animation student, an aspiring writer and 3D artist...also Gryffindor, bibliophile and maladaptive daydreamer.

summary: From the 3D I did during my internship to the first assignment I did at uni...how time passes.

summary: Game of Thrones Season 8 Predictions Imho :-)
title: Game of Thrones Season 8 Predictions Imho :-)
body:
My predictions for Season 8 are purely based on the characters and events of the show. I read the books, all of them and twice, but I won´t refer to them here because I´m quite sure G.R.R. Martin´s “A Song of Ice and Fire” will take a different path, give the characters different choices and reasons, even if it will end similar to the show, seen on the whole.

Dreams shattered. The Stark children and Daenerys

The Starks are introduced as a devoted family yet not without conflicts among themselves. Their children love each other but have very different dreams and hopes. Sansa wants to become the loving wife of a handsome and honorable prince/knight. Arya wants to become a fighter. Robb wants to be like his father. Bran wants to be an adventurer. And bastard Jon wants to belong and to become a knight of the – as he believes – honorable Night´s Watch. Overseas we see Daenerys Targaryen sold to Khal Drogo by her brother Viserys who hopes to conquer Westeros and take back the Iron Throne. Daenerys in the beginning just wants to go “home”, but in fact can´t remember “home”.

Everyone achieves - as it seems - his or her dreams but they are changed into nightmares. Sansa´s beloved prince and fiance is a monster, Arya is turned into an assassin, Robb dies because he is as gullible as his father, Brans adventures turn him into a semi-human cripple, Jon becomes a commander of the Night´s Watch and gets killed by his own comrades. Daenerys finally arrives in Westeros but it doesn´t feel like home at all.

Lady and the Ghost

All the Stark children are connected with ancient powers and magic. Those powers came to life in the very first episode, when they find their direwolfs. Sansa is the first of the Stark children to loose her wolf and therefor her connection with the magic world. Sansa´s arc is about dealing with a hostile and dangerous world without the help of magic and faith. She struggles – but she survives by observing, lying, manipulating and learning. She decides to stay a lady anyway: “Courtesy is a lady´s armor.” And she learns how to rule and how to make a difference: she wants to inspire loyalty by love not fear, she tries to find compromises instead of dictatorship. Season 07 shows how Sansa grows into a leader and that she does well (especially compared to Cersei and Daenerys: Cersei uses fear and is a dictator; Daenerys is loved by her followers but still is a dictator unable to compromise).

Sansa and Jon have reflecting story arcs. Both believed in songs and legends about knights, princes and ladies. Both were terribly disenchanted when they met with the realities of Kings Landing and Castle Black. Both decided to stand by their ideals, anyway. They learnt everything on their separate ways to become the power couple they are in season 6  - to win back the North and to become the best rulers for the North. Sansa learnt to be modest which enables her to inspire love and admiration. Jon learnt to be more suspicious and to convince his subjects not only by acting but also by talking.

But it´s too late for them as a romantic couple, it always was: When Sansa Stark meets her – as both believe – halfbrother Jon again he literally is a Ghost himself (the forshadowing name he gave his white direwolf in the first episode). Resurrected by Melisandre Jon is a wight by fire as much as Beric is. And – as Beric puts it: “We defend those who can´t defend themselves” – he´s resurrected to fight death, the Army of the Dead, the Night King. That´s his purpose. And his tragic, too: Lady and the Ghost are meant for each other (The show used so many romantic tropes even in season 7, that I can´t believe it´s just incompetence.) But Jon and Sansa are not on the same page anymore: Sansa is a human being while Jon is a wight.

Both of them are not totally aware of their feelings for each other at the end of season 7, they don´t know about Jons parentage and they don´t know about the consequences of a magic resurrection. For season 8 all these points promise an emotional roller coaster ride. They will realize they aren´t siblings (but just then Jon turns up with his dragon queen and they will have to hide their feelings once again), they will realize their mutual feelings (and just then they will have to hide them from everyone because they won´t want anyone to know about Jon´s inheritance rights) and when a Happy End will seem possible after all, they will have to face the truth about ressurrections and will have to renounce it, so that Jon will have to die again.

When all is said and done, when the Night King is gone and the realm is secure again, Jon will have fulfilled his destiny while Sansa´s will begin:  Sansa will be the elected queen of the Seven Kingdoms.  

The love of Lady and the Ghost will have to stay a dream, perhaps even a dream only the two of them will ever know about. Bittersweet ending. 


“His is the song of Ice and Fire.” Songs and Politics

Jon himself is the Song of Ice and Fire. He´s half Dragon, half Wolf. Perhaps his father Rhaegar had a vision or read a prophecy that only a prince, half Stark, half Targaryen would be able to defeat the Night King. Perhaps therefore he eloped with Lyanna Stark and fathered Aegon/Jon. But Rhaegar got it wrong: To change the system, to bring stability to Westeros and to begin a new age not only the Night King (Ice) has to be defeated but also the Targaryen Threat/The Rule of the Dragons (Fire) has to be completely destroyed. The longlasting balance between Ice and Fire is gone with the Wall and can´t be reestablished. Magic has to leave Westeros and Jon is the last magic prince to defeat Ice and Fire by sacrificing himself.

He has to kill the Night King and Daenerys Targaryen. In the course he will be wounded and burned (the left part of his face). Maybe Daenerys Targaryen who will betray Jon and attack his family (could be she burns Alys Stark because she confuses her with Sansa) will see her mistakes at the very last  minute just before she dies and ask for forgiveness. Jon won´t die fast but he will succumb to his wounds in the end. Hopefully he will live long enough to see Sansa on the throne.


6 Episodes to run

Episode 1

Tension in Winterfell: The Starks and the Northern Lords won´t be too happy about Jon bending the knee. Sansa realizes that Jon did what he had to do and helps him to convince the Northerners. In private she curses him for his love affair and feels confused about her own feelings. Sam and Bran reveal Jon´s parentage to Jon and his cousins Sansa and Arya. The Starks decide to keep it secret. Jon confesses to Sansa that he doen´t trust Daenerys enough because of her obsession with the Iron Throne. Daenerys tries to be polite and humble but on different occasions her temper shows (perhaps with Sam when his father´s and brother´s fate is revealed, perhaps with Bran or with Arya). Tyrion observes the tension between Daenerys and the Stark family, tries to mediate, flatters Sansa. The Hound shows his admiration for Sansa as well. Jon realizes with confusion his jealousy when he observes Sansa with her admirer. Daenerys sometimes feels neglected. The Northerners are in awe and fear because of the Dragons. Sansa and Daenerys have a dispute about food and the clothing of Daenery´s armies. Everyone will become aware that the Dragon Queen didn´t care when she burnt the harvest of the Reach. The death of the Tarlys is revealed. Daenerys is seen by many for “what she is”, but the Starks try to keep the peace among their allies because they need the dragons to fight the Army of the Dead. Jon has to flatter Daenerys and to make love to her to calm her.

Theon attacks Euron´s ship who brings the Golden Company to Westeros and somehow frees his sisters. Euron survives the attack. Yara promises a dying Theon to go to Winterfell and support Jon in the coming wars. Yara knows about Euron and Cerseis plans. But Euron cut her tongue, so she won´t be able to speak about them.

Jamie is on his way to Winterfell, Bronn joins him.

A raven from Castle Black (Tormund and Beric reached it at last) brings horrible news (Night King, Viserion). Jon asks Daenerys if she is willing to evacuate Castle Black with her dragons. The plan is discussed in the Grand Hall. Sansa advises against it. Yet Jon convinces Daenerys. They´re flying North together. Winterfell is preprared for the coming storm.

To be continued

But it´s too late for them as a romantic couple, it always was: When Sansa Stark meets her – as both believe – halfbrother Jon again he literally is a Ghost himself (the forshadowing name he gave his white direwolf in the first episode). Resurrected by Melisandre Jon is a wight by fire as much as Beric is. And – as Beric puts it: “We defend those who can´t defend themselves” – he´s resurrected to fight death, the Army of the Dead, the Night King. That´s his purpose. And his tragic, too: Lady and the Ghost are meant for each other (The show used so many romantic tropes even in season 7, that I can´t believe it´s just incompetence.) But Jon and Sansa are not on the same page anymore: Sansa is a human being while Jon is a wight.

Both of them are not totally aware of their feelings for each other at the end of season 7, they don´t know about Jons parentage and they don´t know about the consequences of a magic resurrection. For season 8 all these points promise an emotional roller coaster ride. They will realize they aren´t siblings (but just then Jon turns up with his dragon queen and they will have to hide their feelings once again), they will realize their mutual feelings (and just then they will have to hide them from everyone because they won´t want anyone to know about Jon´s inheritance rights) and when a Happy End will seem possible after all, they will have to face the truth about ressurrections and will have to renounce it, so that Jon will have to die again.

When all is said and done, when the Night King is gone and the realm is secure again, Jon will have fulfilled his destiny while Sansa´s will begin:  Sansa will be the elected queen of the Seven Kingdoms.  

The love of Lady and the Ghost will have to stay a dream, perhaps even a dream only the two of them will ever know about. Bittersweet ending. 


“His is the song of Ice and Fire.” Songs and Politics

Jon himself is the Song of Ice and Fire. He´s half Dragon, half Wolf. Perhaps his father Rhaegar had a vision or read a prophecy that only a prince, half Stark, half Targaryen would be able to defeat the Night King. Perhaps therefore he eloped with Lyanna Stark and fathered Aegon/Jon. But Rhaegar got it wrong: To change the system, to bring stability to Westeros and to begin a new age not only the Night King (Ice) has to be defeated but also the Targaryen Threat/The Rule of the Dragons (Fire) has to be completely destroyed. The longlasting balance between Ice and Fire is gone with the Wall and can´t be reestablished. Magic has to leave Westeros and Jon is the last magic prince to defeat Ice and Fire by sacrificing himself.

He has to kill the Night King and Daenerys Targaryen. In the course he will be wounded and burned (the left part of his face). Maybe Daenerys Targaryen who will betray Jon and attack his family (could be she burns Alys Stark because she confuses her with Sansa) will see her mistakes at the very last  minute just before she dies and ask for forgiveness. Jon won´t die fast but he will succumb to his wounds in the end. Hopefully he will live long enough to see Sansa on the throne.


6 Episodes to run

Episode 1

Tension in Winterfell: The Starks and the Northern Lords won´t be too happy about Jon bending the knee. Sansa realizes that Jon did what he had to do and helps him to convince the Northerners. In private she curses him for his love affair and feels confused about her own feelings. Sam and Bran reveal Jon´s parentage to Jon and his cousins Sansa and Arya. The Starks decide to keep it secret. Jon confesses to Sansa that he doen´t trust Daenerys enough because of her obsession with the Iron Throne. Daenerys tries to be polite and humble but on different occasions her temper shows (perhaps with Sam when his father´s and brother´s fate is revealed, perhaps with Bran or with Arya). Tyrion observes the tension between Daenerys and the Stark family, tries to mediate, flatters Sansa. The Hound shows his admiration for Sansa as well. Jon realizes with confusion his jealousy when he observes Sansa with her admirer. Daenerys sometimes feels neglected. The Northerners are in awe and fear because of the Dragons. Sansa and Daenerys have a dispute about food and the clothing of Daenery´s armies. Everyone will become aware that the Dragon Queen didn´t care when she burnt the harvest of the Reach. The death of the Tarlys is revealed. Daenerys is seen by many for “what she is”, but the Starks try to keep the peace among their allies because they need the dragons to fight the Army of the Dead. Jon has to flatter Daenerys and to make love to her to calm her.

Theon attacks Euron´s ship who brings the Golden Company to Westeros and somehow frees his sisters. Euron survives the attack. Yara promises a dying Theon to go to Winterfell and support Jon in the coming wars. Yara knows about Euron and Cerseis plans. But Euron cut her tongue, so she won´t be able to speak about them.

Jamie is on his way to Winterfell, Bronn joins him.

A raven from Castle Black (Tormund and Beric reached it at last) brings horrible news (Night King, Viserion). Jon asks Daenerys if she is willing to evacuate Castle Black with her dragons. The plan is discussed in the Grand Hall. Sansa advises against it. Yet Jon convinces Daenerys. They´re flying North together. Winterfell is preprared for the coming storm.

To be continued

summary: Fire and Ice - ellymelly - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Fire and Ice - ellymelly - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 105/?
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Mature
Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death
Relationships: Jorah Mormont/Daenerys Targaryen, Petyr Baelish/Sansa Stark, Gilly (ASoIaF)/Samwell Tarly, jornerys
Characters: Jorah Mormont, Daenerys Targaryen, Tyrion Lannister, Daario Naharis, Jeor Mormont, Grey Worm, Varys (ASoIaF), Melisandre of Asshai, Missandei (ASoIaF), Sansa Stark, Theon Greyjoy, Brienne of Tarth, Samwell Tarly, Gilly (ASoIaF), Podrick Payne, Drogon, Rhaegal, Viserion, Jon Snow, Jon Connington, Tormund Giantsbane, Edd Tollett, Davos Seaworth, Ghost (ASoIaF), Euron Greyjoy, Blood Raven, Brynden Rivers, Maester Aemon, Petyr Baelish, Bran Stark, Quaithe (ASoIaF), Shiera Seastar, Arya Stark, Jaqen H'ghar, Illyrio Mopatis, Nymeria, Leyton Hightower, Robett Glover, Ramsay Bolton, Lyanna Mormont, Harrion Karstark, Pol Qo, Bu Gai, Rhaella Targaryen, Jaime Lannister, Aerys II Targaryen, Mance Rayder, Tycho Nestoris, Dacey Mormont, Gendry Waters, Willem Darry, Quentyn Martell, Doran Martell, Anders Yronwood, Cersei Lannister, Tommen Baratheon, Ned Stark, Ashara Dayne, Loras Tyrell, Margaery Tyrell, Olenna Tyrell, The High Sparrow, Yara Greyjoy, azor ahai - Character, Bloodstone Emperor, Bronn (ASoIaF), Alliser Thorne, Sandor Clegane, Sand Snakes, Arianne Martell, Gerold Dayne, Darkstar, Marwyn the Mage
Summary:

There has always been more to Ser Jorah Mormont than a disgraced sell sword surviving on the edge of the world. His is the story of Fire and Ice. Azor Ahai prophecy.

summary: Season 1, Episode 3 “Lord Snow” “What did the Mad King say, when you stabbed him in the back? I never asked. Did he call you a...
body:
Season 1, Episode 3 “Lord Snow”

“What did the Mad King say, when you stabbed him in the back? I never asked. Did he call you a traitor? He plead for reprieve?”

“He said the same thing he’d been saying for hours. Burn them all.”


Though this is still the Jamie everyone hates - mostly for sleeping with his twin sister and trying to kill Bran - we are shown for the first time, that there may be something more to him.

summary: So many tags. They make you tag and tag. Tag this as that, tag that as this, tag this as anti, there’s not enough content for...
body:
So many tags. They make you tag and tag. Tag this as that, tag that as this, tag this as anti, there’s not enough content for the pro tag, that is not positive enough for this tag.

It’s too much. No matter what you tag, you’re forsaking one tag or another.

reblog.comment:
So many tags. They make you tag and tag. Tag this as that, tag that as this, tag this as anti, there’s not enough content for the pro tag, that is not positive enough for this tag.

It’s too much. No matter what you tag, you’re forsaking one tag or another.

trail.content_raw:
So many tags. They make you tag and tag. Tag this as that, tag that as this, tag this as anti, there’s not enough content for the pro tag, that is not positive enough for this tag.

It’s too much. No matter what you tag, you’re forsaking one tag or another.
trail.content:
So many tags. They make you tag and tag. Tag this as that, tag that as this, tag this as anti, there’s not enough content for the pro tag, that is not positive enough for this tag.

It’s too much. No matter what you tag, you’re forsaking one tag or another.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: During her time as Queen Rhaella’s lady-in-waiting, Joanna had befriended the Princess of Dorne, another member of the court....
caption:
During her time as Queen Rhaella’s lady-in-waiting, Joanna had befriended the Princess of Dorne, another member of the court. The Dornish Princess had two children, Oberyn and Elia Martell, who were not yet promised in marriage, so the two women planned to have their children be wed to each other.

asoiaf ua: Tywin accepted the engagement between Jaime and Elia.
